text: Sarah Sutton (born 12 December 1961 in Basingstoke, Hampshire, England) is an English actress. She is well known for her role as Nyssa in the BBC television series Doctor Who. Nyssa was a companion of Tom Baker and Peter Davison's Doctors from 1981 to 1983. She was the youngest female actor to play a companion in the series. Since leaving Doctor Who she has done very little acting.Davies, Barbara. "Who's That Girl?; After The Tardis: We Track Down The Time Lord's Assistants". The Mirror: pp. 22â€“23. 24 March 2005. (via Lexis- Nexis). She has made appearances as Sarah Dryden in the BBC's medical drama series Casualty and as Wendy in the serial Unnatural Pursuits. Earlier roles were Alice Through the Looking Glass (1974) as Alice, The Moon Stallion (1978) as Diana Purwell and The Crucible (1980) as Susannah Walcott. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Actors from Hampshire Category:English television actors Category:People from Basingstoke Category:1961 births Category:Living people
title: Sarah Sutton
